comment: His lectures are clear and it is very easy to ask him questions. He gives lots of homework, which is helpful because it balances out your grade (tests are very). Best thing is that if you show him you tried a problem he will help find your mistake. Not an easy class but he will help/ clarify every time you ask. Great professor!

He posts lectures online, this is not a reason to not show up. He really does focus more towards students who want to continue the accounting pathway. He does expect you already have an understanding of Finance. He is available after class, and used to work at KPMG.

This was very much an accounting 2102 class; lots of homework and resources outside of class. I stopped going to class since lots of the examples in class felt a little too advanced or unnecessary and were more for people who enjoyed accounting. Professor Park was super easy to reach, responds quick! Can be an easy A if you want
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Went to this class I think a total of 2.5 times and got an A. Just do all (most) the assignments in connect and your golden.

Professor Park is very lecture-based and attendance is very important. Two exams are a combined 30% of your grade. The final exam is also 30% of your grade. All of the exams are also online using Proctorio. In case you struggle in the class, he also includes lots of extra credit activities to help your grade. I would recommend this professor.

Knows the subject very well, is a great lecturer and cares about teaching data analytics to accounting students. He walks the class through lots of examples to practice and tests are based on similar questions. Not homework heavy, and there are opportunities for extra credit. Solid choice for 4550.
